subject: Re: [junit] Enhancing JUnit myself, how to?
msgSnippet: ... Nice!  But I thought that Rules were defined for an entire class, so is it possible to have two different error messages for two methods that belong to the
messageBody:
On Thu, Oct 22, 2009 at 7:33 PM, David Saff <david@...> wrote:

> > On the other hand, something that I've found useful in TestNG is being
> able
> > to test the error message against a regular exception:
> >
> > @Test(expectedException=MyException.class, errorMessage = ".*Too big.*")
> >
> > You might want to consider this for JUnit since it's applicable
> regardless
> > of the exception class.
>
> Already considered and implemented as a Rule in JUnit 4.7!


Nice! But I thought that Rules were defined for an entire class, so is it
possible to have two different error messages for two methods that belong to
the same class?

--
Cédric


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
